c74object.name: bach.portal
c74object.description: Performs no operation upon the incoming llll, except optional format (text/native) conversions.

outlet.description: The llll coming from the corresponding inlet is immediately output unchanged.

If bach.portal's out attribute is set to p, its outlets are not immediately initialized as soon as the patch is loaded. For this reason, a message coming from a loadbang or loadmess object might get lost, or be output in the wrong format. When bach.portal is ready, it outputs a bang from its rightmost outlet which can be used to trigger any message to output automatically when the patch is loaded.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in any inlet is immediately output from the current outlet unchanged, except for the optional format conversion according to the out attribute.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

c74object.discussion: As usual, the formats of the output lllls are controlled by the out attribute. In bach.portal, though, the latter can have an additional value, p, which allows controlling the output format for subpatchers and abstractions. If bach.portal's out attribute is set to p, its outlets are not immediately initialized as soon as the patch is loaded. For this reason, a message coming from a loadbang or loadmess object might get lost, or be output in the wrong format. When bach.portal is ready, it outputs a bang from its rightmost outlet which can be used to trigger any message to output automatically when the patch is loaded. bach.portal has a communication mechanism with bach.args, ensuring that for each subpatcher bach.portal is ready when bach.args outputs its arguments. In this way, it is safe for the arguments of the patch to trigger messages to the outside of the patch itself.

entry.name: Outlets 1, 2, 3... (llll)
entry.description: Output llll. The llll coming from the corresponding inlet is immediately output unchanged.

entry.name: The last Outlet (llll)
entry.description: Bang when ready. If bach.portal's out attribute is set to p, its outlets are not immediately initialized as soon as the patch is loaded. For this reason, a message coming from a loadbang or loadmess object might get lost, or be output in the wrong format. When bach.portal is ready, it outputs a bang from its rightmost outlet which can be used to trigger any message to output automatically when the patch is loaded.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: As usual, the formats of the output lllls are controlled by the out attribute. In bach.portal, though, the latter can have an additional value, p, which allows controlling the output format for subpatchers and abstractions. If bach.portal's out attribute is set to p, its outlets are not immediately initialized as soon as the patch is loaded. For this reason, a message coming from a loadbang or loadmess object might get lost, or be output in the wrong format. When bach.portal is ready, it outputs a bang from its rightmost outlet which can be used to trigger any message to output automatically when the patch is loaded. bach.portal has a communication mechanism with bach.args, ensuring that for each subpatcher bach.portal is ready when bach.args outputs its arguments. In this way, it is safe for the arguments of the patch to trigger messages to the outside of the patch itself.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: portal, text, native, disabled, outlet, convert.
